page.title: 01 Eastham - The Place
page.content: {Eastham}started off as a small village which was mentioned in{William {the Conqueror's Domesday Book. The oldest part of Eastham is the church and the houses around it. The A41 divides the new part of Eastham from the old. Eastham is a quiet place and is mainly residential with no big shopping areas. {Eastham Ferry,}where ferries used to take people to{Liverpool,}has been blocked up with mud so now it's not possible for ferries to dock. The rest of the land is used for farming and for oil storage depots. The{Manchester Ship Canal}starts at Eastham and runs parallel to the{River {Mersey}until it goes inland to {Manchester.
